poem:
### Unfurnished Future

In a room bare as time,  
young aspirations learn;  
no pillow for dreams,  
they seek the tools—  
a fan to stir still hopes,  
lamp to illuminate paths  
uncut by others.  
The heart's quiet shelf  
needs more than fabric;  
it cradles ambitions,  
hung on invisible hangers,  
awaiting warmth  
to enflesh them.
